title: feat: add release-tracker integration to schematic-viewer
description: Integrates release-tracker into schematic-viewer workflows by adding workflows to notify on feature merges and version updates.
body:
## PR Description

Integrate release-tracker into schematic-viewer workflows

- Add `on-merge-inform-release-tracker.yml` to send feature_merged events when PRs are merged
- Update `pver-release.yml` to notify release-tracker of version updates with package.json data
- Enables tracking of features as they flow through the tscircuit release pipeline

title: feat: add release-tracker integration to pcb-viewer
description: Integrates release-tracker into pcb-viewer workflows by adding notifications for feature merges and version updates.
body:
## PR Description

Integrate release-tracker into pcb-viewer workflows

- Add `on-merge-inform-release-tracker.yml` to send feature_merged events when PRs are merged
- Update `pver-release.yml` to notify release-tracker of version updates with package.json data
- Enables tracking of features as they flow through the tscircuit release pipeline

title: Refactor: add support PcbHoleCircle and PcbHoleRect
description: Adds support for circular and rectangular holes in PCB design, allowing for more versatile hole shapes in circuit layouts.

title: Add optional shape property to PCBBoard (follow-up to #339)
description: Adds an optional shape property to the PCBBoard interface, allowing specification of board shape as either rectangular or polygonal, while maintaining backward compatibility.
body:
This PR adds an optional [shape](vscode-file://vscode-app/d:/Microsoft%20VS%20Code/resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-browser/workbench/workbench.html) property to the [PCBBoard](vscode-file://vscode-app/d:/Microsoft%20VS%20Code/resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-browser/workbench/workbench.html) interface as a follow-up to #339.

### Changes:
- Added optional [shape](vscode-file://vscode-app/d:/Microsoft%20VS%20Code/resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-browser/workbench/workbench.html) property with values "rect" or "polygon" to both the Zod schema and TypeScript interface
- Added 3 new tests to verify the shape property works correctly

This makes intent clear - Explicitly documents whether a board is rectangular or outlined
Improves type safety - Consuming code can switch on the shape type
Maintains backward compatibility - Property is optional, so existing code without it still works
Future-proofs - Easy to extend with new shapes like "circular", "polygon", etc.

### Behavior
Optional property - Boards without [shape](vscode-file://vscode-app/d:/Microsoft%20VS%20Code/resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-browser/workbench/workbench.html) specified will have it as undefined
Backward compatible - All existing code continues to work

### Use Cases

// Explicitly rectangular
{ shape: "rectangular", width: 10, height: 20 }

// Explicitly polygon  
{ shape: "polygon", outline: [...points] }

// Backward compatible - shape is undefined
{ width: 10, height: 20 }

### Testing
âœ… All 6 tests pass
âœ… Build succeeds

Related to tscircuit/core#1516

title: Make PCBBoard width and height optional for outlined boards
description: This PR makes the width and height properties optional on the PCBBoard interface to support boards with custom outlines.
body:
This PR makes the `width` and `height` properties optional on the `PCBBoard` interface to support boards with custom outlines.

Currently, `PCBBoard` requires `width` and `height` as mandatory properties. However, when a board has a custom `outline` (defined by an array of points), these dimensions should not be present since the board's shape and size are determined by the outline itself.

## Changes
- Changed `width: number` to `width?: number` 
- Changed `height: number` to `height?: number`

## Use Cases
- **Rectangular boards**: specify `width` and `height`
- **Outlined/custom-shaped boards**: omit `width`/`height`, use `outline` instead

## Related
This change enables proper support for non-rectangular board shapes in tscircuit/core (tscircuit/core#1516).
Which in turn will also help PR#1614

- New test file added to check for this (pcb_board.test.ts)
- Existing tests should pass (rectangular boards still work)
- New functionality: boards with outlines can now properly omit width/height

title: Introduce RectHoleProps for rectangular hole support
description: Adds RectHoleProps interface for rectangular hole support in PCB layout, expanding the HoleProps type to include rectangular holes.

title: feat: add minTraceWidth in group
description: Adds an optional property, minTraceWidth, to group components for specifying minimum trace width in TypeScript interfaces and schema validation.
body:
This pull request introduces support for a new optional property, `minTraceWidth`, across the codebase for group components. The changes update both the TypeScript interfaces and the associated schema validation to ensure consistency and proper type-checking.

Add support for `minTraceWidth` property:

**Type and Interface Updates**
* Added `minTraceWidth?: Distance` to the `BaseGroupProps` TypeScript interface in both `lib/components/group.ts` and the documentation in `README.md`, allowing group components to optionally specify a minimum trace width. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-fb507e0fca2930b0b83ea9c3c84ba4a268007ca8b0e91651fb149ffd8c86b287R199) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-b335630551682c19a781afebcf4d07bf978fb1f8ac04c6bf87428ed5106870f5R670)

**Schema Validation**
* Updated the `baseGroupProps` Zod schema to include an optional `minTraceWidth` property, ensuring that the new property is validated when present.

This would allow `<group minTraceWidth={0.3}>` syntax

Required for group-level trace width inheritance

title: Add TQFP support with defaults for common pin counts
description: Add intelligent defaults for TQFP footprints, allowing users to specify common pin layouts without needing to manually input all parameters each time.
body: ## Add intelligent defaults for TQFP footprints ### What This Does This PR adds **common default pin layouts for TQFP** (Thin Quad Flat Package) footprints, similar to how QFP and LQFP footprints work in this library. Previously, TQFP was implemented as a bare pass-through to the `quad()` function with only `legsoutside = true` set. Users had to manually specify all parameters (pitch, pad width, pad length) every time, which was not user-friendly. **This PR adds intelligent defaults based on pin count**, so users can now simply write: - `tqfp32_w7` instead of `tqfp32_w7_p0.8mm_pw0.45mm_pl1.45mm` - `tqfp64_w10` instead of `tqfp64_w10_p0.5mm_pw0.3mm_pl1.475mm` - `tqfp100_w14` instead of `tqfp100_w14_p0.5mm_pw0.25mm_pl1.6mm` ### Changes **Added intelligent defaults for common TQFP pin counts:** | Pin Count | Default Pitch | Default Pad Width | Default Pad Length | |-----------|---------------|-------------------|-------------------| | 32 | 0.8mm | 0.45mm | 1.45mm | | 44 | 0.5mm | 0.3mm | 1.45mm | | 48 | 0.5mm | 0.3mm | 1.45mm | | 64 | 0.5mm | 0.3mm | 1.475mm | | 80 | 0.5mm | 0.3mm | 1.475mm | | 100 | 0.5mm | 0.25mm | 1.6mm | | 144 | 0.5mm | 0.25mm | 1.6mm | These defaults are based on common TQFP package specifications from major manufacturers (STMicroelectronics, Texas Instruments, NXP, etc.) and JEDEC standards. **Users can still override any parameter** if needed for specific components. ### Tests Added - `tqfp32_w7` - TQFP-32 with 7mm body - `tqfp44_w10` - TQFP-44 with 10mm body - `tqfp48_w7` - TQFP-48 with 7mm body - `tqfp100_w14` - TQFP-100 with 14mm body - `tqfp64_w10_p0.5mm_pw0.3_pl1.475mm` - TQFP-64 with explicit parameters (Unchanged) All tests pass with snapshot validation. Reference: https://www.ti.com/packaging/docs/searchtipackages.tsp?packageName=QFP --- Closes #410

title: ci: pin to bun:1.3.1 instead of latest to fix bun test errors

title: Add SVG snapshots and tests for MELF, MicroMELF, and MiniMELF components
description: Adds new parity snapshot tests for MELF diode footprints, ensuring that the generated SVGs from the Footprinter tool match those from KiCad for several MELF package variants.
body:
This pull request adds new parity snapshot tests for MELF diode footprints, ensuring that the generated SVGs from the Footprinter tool match those from KiCad for several MELF package variants. Each test compares the SVG output and boolean difference for a specific MELF footprint.

New MELF parity tests:

* Added a test for the standard MELF footprint, comparing Footprinter and KiCad outputs and their SVG boolean difference (`melf_kicad_parity.test.ts`).
* Added a test for the Mini MELF footprint, performing the same SVG and boolean difference comparison (`mini_melf_kicad_parity.test.ts`).
* Added a test for the Micro MELF footprint, also comparing SVG outputs and boolean differences (`micro_melf_kicad_parity.test.ts`).

title: feat: add visual verification for pcbStyle silkscreen font size override
description: Adds visual verification for the pcbStyle.silkscreenFontSize override by including a silkscreen text element and dimension annotation to ensure correct font size rendering in tests.
body: ## PR Description Enhanced the `pcbStyle.silkscreenFontSize` override test with visual indicators: - Added silkscreen text element to verify font size override - Added dimension annotation showing expected text height (2mm) - Increased board size and reposition components for clarity The dimension line acts as a visual contract - it shows the expected text height (2mm). If someone breaks the `pcbStyle.silkscreenFontSize` override in the future, the snapshot will show obviously incorrect sizing where the text no longer matches its dimension annotation.

title: feat: Refactor copper pour to use @tscircuit/copper-pour-solver
description: Replaces the internal copper pour generation logic with the new tscircuitcopper-pour-solver package, delegating complex geometry calculations to a dedicated package.
body:
This PR replaces the internal copper pour generation logic with the new @tscircuit/copper-pour-solver package.                            

The new implementation uses convertCircuitJsonToInputProblem to prepare the data for the solver and then utilizes CopperPourPipelineSolver to generate the BRep shapes for the pour.                                                                                                 

This change delegates complex geometry calculations to a more robust, dedicated package.                                                  

 â€¢ Replaced pour generation logic in CopperPour.ts                                                                                        
 â€¢ Added @tscircuit/copper-pour-solver dependency                                                                                         
 â€¢ Updated and added tests to reflect the new implementation and verify margin functionality

title: feat: pass resolvedPcbStyle to footprint loaders for kicad footprints
description: Implements pcbStyle inheritance for kicad: footprints by passing the resolved pcbStyle to footprintLibraryMap functions, enabling override of silkscreen font size and other style properties.
body:
## PR Description
This PR implements `pcbStyle` inheritance for `kicad:*` footprints by passing the resolved pcbStyle to footprintLibraryMap functions, enabling override of silkscreen font size and other style properties.

### Changes Done

  - Updated footprint loader function signature to accept optional `resolvedPcbStyle` parameter
  - Retrieved inherited `pcbStyle` from component hierarchy 
  - Passed complete `resolvedPcbStyle` object to footprint loader functions
  - Updated `@tscircuit/props` dependency

### Tests Added
  - Verifies `resolvedPcbStyle` is correctly passed to footprint loaders
  - Confirms `pcbStyle.silkscreenFontSize` overrides kicad footprint font sizes

## Usage Example
```tsx
<board pcbStyle={{ silkscreenFontSize: 2 }}>
  <resistor footprint="kicad:R_0402_1005Metric" />
  {/* Silkscreen text will use font size 2 instead of KiCad default */}
</board>

title: Fixed qfp, tqfp, and lqfp `padContactLength`, and updated test snapshots
description: Fixes inaccuracies in the rendering of QFP, LQFP, and TQFP chip components by adjusting lead placements, body rendering, and physical parameters for better alignment with real-world specifications.
body: This pull request updates the QFP, LQFP, and TQFP chip rendering components in the `lib/qfp.tsx`, `lib/lqfp.tsx`, and `lib/tqfp.tsx` files. The main goal is to improve the accuracy of the chip body and lead placements, as well as to refine some physical parameters for better visual fidelity and consistency with real-world packages. **Chip lead and body placement adjustments:** * Increased the offset for lead positions on all four sides in both `LQFP` and `QFP` components, resulting in more accurate placement of leads relative to the chip body. (`lib/lqfp.tsx` [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-e2aaaf7029c344637e3889a16c67bd876f14a66fc3f231fb9e0d0f3bf92d9cceL43-R43) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-e2aaaf7029c344637e3889a16c67bd876f14a66fc3f231fb9e0d0f3bf92d9cceL61-R61) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-e2aaaf7029c344637e3889a16c67bd876f14a66fc3f231fb9e0d0f3bf92d9cceL80-R80) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-e2aaaf7029c344637e3889a16c67bd876f14a66fc3f231fb9e0d0f3bf92d9cceL98-R98); `lib/qfp.tsx` [[5]](diffhunk://#diff-9011c2de31ee473491158b3220977f8995bcba14b539fb9a0d666861acb6116eL40-R40) [[6]](diffhunk://#diff-9011c2de31ee473491158b3220977f8995bcba14b539fb9a0d666861acb6116eL58-R58) [[7]](diffhunk://#diff-9011c2de31ee473491158b3220977f8995bcba14b539fb9a0d666861acb6116eL77-R77) [[8]](diffhunk://#diff-9011c2de31ee473491158b3220977f8995bcba14b539fb9a0d666861acb6116eL95-R95) * Adjusted the calculation for `bodyDistance` in both `LQFP` and `QFP` to increase the spacing between the body and leads. (`lib/lqfp.tsx` [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-e2aaaf7029c344637e3889a16c67bd876f14a66fc3f231fb9e0d0f3bf92d9cceL34-R34); `lib/qfp.tsx` [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-9011c2de31ee473491158b3220977f8995bcba14b539fb9a0d666861acb6116eL31-R31) **Chip body rendering improvements:** * Changed the Z-center position for the chip body in all three components to be at `z: 0` instead of offset by half the lead thickness, improving vertical alignment. (`lib/lqfp.tsx` [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-e2aaaf7029c344637e3889a16c67bd876f14a66fc3f231fb9e0d0f3bf92d9cceL110-R110); `lib/qfp.tsx` [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-9011c2de31ee473491158b3220977f8995bcba14b539fb9a0d666861acb6116eL107-R112); `lib/tqfp.tsx` [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-50195257c8f77d50ad818d4f7e49aeebb77bff5eec212f4a3d4466954717f9afL93-R97) * Updated chamfer size and taper ratio values for `QFP` and `TQFP` bodies for more realistic edge beveling. (`lib/qfp.tsx` [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-9011c2de31ee473491158b3220977f8995bcba14b539fb9a0d666861acb6116eL107-R112); `lib/tqfp.tsx` [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-50195257c8f77d50ad818d4f7e49aeebb77bff5eec212f4a3d4466954717f9afL93-R97) **Physical parameter refinements:** * Modified the default lead height for `TQFP` to match more typical package specifications. (`lib/tqfp.tsx` [lib/tqfp.tsxL15-R15](diffhunk://#diff-50195257c8f77d50ad818d4f7e49aeebb77bff5eec212f4a3d4466954717f9afL15-R15)) * Refined the pad contact length logic in `QFP` to provide more accurate values based on pin count, improving footprint generation. (`lib/qfp.tsx` [lib/qfp.tsxL140-R150](diffhunk://#diff-9011c2de31ee473491158b3220977f8995bcba14b539fb9a0d666861acb6116eL140-R150)) ## Before: ## After: /fix #207

title: Implemented SOD882 also added snapshot test for SOD882 with example
description: Adds support for the SOD882 diode package to the 3D footprint rendering library, including implementation, integration, example usage, and snapshot testing.
body: This pull request adds support for the SOD882 diode package to the 3D footprint rendering library. The main changes include the implementation of the new `SOD882` component, integration into the main footprint renderer, and the addition of a corresponding example and test. **SOD882 package integration:** * Added a new `SOD882` component in `lib/SOD882.tsx` to render the 3D model of the SOD882 diode package. * Updated `lib/Footprinter3d.tsx` to support rendering the SOD882 footprint when selected. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-8ef5003688394a782da38d10f8dd9c9ece9af16db5a43ce66b655e6c19bb0bc9R23) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-8ef5003688394a782da38d10f8dd9c9ece9af16db5a43ce66b655e6c19bb0bc9R215-R216) * Exported the `SOD882` component from `lib/index.ts` for use throughout the library. **Examples and testing:** * Added an example usage of the SOD882 footprint in `examples/SOD882.example.tsx`. * Added a snapshot test for the SOD882 footprint in `tests/snapshots/sod882.test.ts` to ensure correct rendering. ## Image: ## Ref: https://assets.nexperia.com/documents/package-information/SOD882.pdf

title: Fix: Update snapshot tests for components using notch â€” previously skipped due to <5% diff
description: Adds notchRadius property to QFP, LQFP, and TQFP components for accurate notch rendering and updates snapshot tests that were previously skipped due to minimal differences.
body: This pull request makes a small but important update to the rendering logic for QFP, LQFP, and TQFP components. The change adds the `notchRadius` property to each package type, ensuring that the notch is drawn with the correct radius for each footprint. Component rendering improvements: * Added `notchRadius` prop to the `QFP` component, setting it to half of 1.5 units for accurate notch sizing. * Added `notchRadius` prop to the `LQFP` component, also set to half of 1.5 units for consistency. * Added `notchRadius` prop to the `TQFP` component, set to half of 1.2 units to match its specific geometry. Also updates shapshot for components which uses notch, they were not updated in previous commit as the diff was less than 5% threshold, it was around 0.2% to 1.7% diff, but this was causing drastic change in models For example: Before: ![Screenshot_20251108_003153](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d8976561-028c-42a1-8635-d27ee60d9329) After: Do we need to reduce the threshold ??

title: Add MicroMELF component and update Footprinter3d and tests
description: Adds support for rendering the MicroMELF package in the 3D footprint visualizer, including a new component and tests.
body: This pull request adds support for rendering the MicroMELF package in the 3D footprint visualizer. It introduces a new `MicroMELF` component, integrates it into the main footprint rendering logic, and provides an example and a snapshot test to ensure correct rendering. **MicroMELF package support:** * Added new `MicroMELF` component in `lib/MicroMELF.tsx` to render the MicroMELF package using `jscad-fiber` primitives. * Exported `MicroMELF` from `lib/index.ts` for use throughout the codebase. * Integrated `MicroMELF` into the `Footprinter3d` component, allowing `"micromelf"` and `"micro_melf"` footprints to be rendered. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-8ef5003688394a782da38d10f8dd9c9ece9af16db5a43ce66b655e6c19bb0bc9R35) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-8ef5003688394a782da38d10f8dd9c9ece9af16db5a43ce66b655e6c19bb0bc9R217-R219) **Examples and testing:** * Added a usage example for the MicroMELF package in `examples/MicroMELF.example.tsx`. * Added a snapshot test to verify correct rendering of the MicroMELF package in `tests/snapshots/micromelf.test.ts`. ## Image: ## Ref: https://www.vishay.com/docs/85566/mlc4148.pdf

title: Add Minimelf cad model
description: Add a new MINIMELF component and its corresponding 3D model to the library, along with an example usage.

title: Added MELF component with example and test
description: Adds support for the MELF (Metal Electrode Leadless Face) package by introducing a new MELF component for rendering, integrating it into the main rendering logic, and providing an example and test for the new package.
body: This pull request adds support for the MELF (Metal Electrode Leadless Face) package. It introduces a new `MELF` component for rendering MELF packages, integrates it into the main rendering logic, and adds an example and a test for the new package. **MELF package support:** * Added a new `MELF` component in `lib/MELF.tsx` to render MELF packages with customizable dimensions and colors. * Registered the `MELF` component in the main 3D footprint rendering logic in `lib/Footprinter3d.tsx`, allowing the "melf" footprint string to be recognized and rendered. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-8ef5003688394a782da38d10f8dd9c9ece9af16db5a43ce66b655e6c19bb0bc9R35) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-8ef5003688394a782da38d10f8dd9c9ece9af16db5a43ce66b655e6c19bb0bc9L214-R217) * Exported the `MELF` component from `lib/index.ts` for use in other modules. **Examples and testing:** * Added an example usage of the MELF package in `examples/MELF.example.tsx` for demonstration and manual testing. * Added a snapshot test for the MELF package in `tests/snapshots/melf.test.ts` to ensure correct rendering. ## Image: ## Ref: https://www.diodes.com/assets/Package-Files/MELF.pdf

title: Add snapshot test for MSOP package rendering
description: Adds support for the MSOP chip package to the 3D footprint rendering library, including a new MSOP component, integration into the renderer, and test coverage.
body: This pull request adds support for the MSOP (Mini Small Outline Package) chip package to the 3D footprint rendering library. It introduces a new `MSOP` component, integrates it into the 3D footprint renderer, and provides an example and test coverage for the new package type. **New MSOP Package Support:** * Introduced a new `MSOP` component for rendering MSOP chip packages, including pin and body geometry, modeled after the existing TSSOP implementation (`lib/MSOP.tsx`). * Exported the `MSOP` component in the main library index for external use (`lib/index.ts`). **Integration with 3D Renderer:** * Added the `MSOP` component to the `Footprinter3d` renderer, enabling automatic rendering of MSOP footprints based on footprint data (`lib/Footprinter3d.tsx`). [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-8ef5003688394a782da38d10f8dd9c9ece9af16db5a43ce66b655e6c19bb0bc9R4) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-8ef5003688394a782da38d10f8dd9c9ece9af16db5a43ce66b655e6c19bb0bc9R73-R82) **Examples and Testing:** * Added an example usage of the `MSOP` package in the `examples/MSOP.example.tsx` file for demonstration purposes. * Added a snapshot test for the MSOP package to ensure correct rendering output (`tests/snapshots/msop.test.ts`). **Minor Bug Fixes:** * Fixed the notch rendering in `ChipBody` to use the correct radius value (`lib/ChipBody.tsx`). * Previusely passing the `notchRadius` ni the `ChipBody` was not working. ## Image: ## Ref: https://www.alldatasheet.com/datasheet-pdf/view/510324/AME/MSOP-8.html

title: Add MS012 component and example, update Footprinter3d and index exports
description: Adds support for the MS-012 chip package to the 3D footprint rendering system, including a new component, integration into the renderer, and a test for rendering correctness.
body: This pull request adds support for the MS-012 chip package to the 3D footprint rendering system. The main changes include implementing the new `MS012` component, integrating it into the footprint renderer, and adding a test to ensure it renders correctly. **MS-012 Package Support** * Added a new `MS012` component in `lib/ms-012.tsx` for rendering the MS-012 chip package, with configurable pin count, dimensions, and lead parameters. * Integrated the `MS012` component into the `Footprinter3d` renderer, allowing footprints with the "ms-012" identifier to be rendered as 3D models. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-8ef5003688394a782da38d10f8dd9c9ece9af16db5a43ce66b655e6c19bb0bc9R35) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-8ef5003688394a782da38d10f8dd9c9ece9af16db5a43ce66b655e6c19bb0bc9R217-R226) * Exported the `MS012` component from the main library index for external usage. * Added an example usage of the `MS012` component in `examples/ms-012.example.tsx`. **Testing** * Added a test in `tests/ms-012.test.ts` to verify that the `MS012` component renders without errors. ## Image: ## Ref https://www.alldatasheet.com/datasheet-pdf/view/433638/LITTELFUSE/MS-012.html

title: Add showAnchorOffsets option for PCB components positioned relative to groups
description: Adds a debug feature to visualize anchor position offsets for PCB components positioned relative to groups, including dimension lines and markers for clarity.
body: # Implements visualization of anchor position offsets for PCB components positioned relative to groups This PR adds a debug feature to help visualize and debug positioning issues with PCB components that are positioned relative to PCB groups. ## Changes - Added `showAnchorOffsets?: boolean` option to PCB converter - Creates white "+" crosshair markers at group anchor positions - Displays dimension lines showing X/Y offsets in millimeters - Dashed connector line from group anchor to component center - Small circle marker at component position ## Positioning Logic **X dimension lines:** - Positioned on the opposite side of the component based on Y direction - If component is above anchor (positive Y) â†’ line goes above component - If component is below anchor (negative Y) â†’ line goes below component - Label positioned in same direction as line **Y dimension lines:** - Positioned on the outer side of the component - Extends from group anchor to component position - Label positioned on the same side as the component for clarity **Dynamic offsets:** - Spacing adapts to component size to avoid overlaps - Uses component width/height to calculate appropriate gaps - Distance-based multiplier for proportional positioning ## Technical Details - Only works with `pcb_component` elements that have: - `positioned_relative_to_pcb_group_id` property - `position_mode: "relative"` property - Fixed component rendering to properly handle relative positioning - Components with `position_mode: "relative"` now render at `groupCenter + relativeOffset` - Renamed from "silkscreen" to "component" to reflect actual usage ## Files Modified - `lib/pcb/convert-circuit-json-to-pcb-svg.ts` - Added `showAnchorOffsets` to Options and PcbContext - `lib/pcb/svg-object-fns/create-svg-objects-from-pcb-component.ts` - Integrated offset indicators and fixed relative positioning - `lib/pcb/svg-object-fns/create-svg-objects-from-pcb-silkscreen-text.ts` - Removed anchor offset code (not supported for text) - `lib/utils/create-pcb-component-anchor-offset-indicators.ts` - Core implementation (renamed from silkscreen version) ## Tests - `tests/pcb/pcb-component-relative-to-group.test.ts` - Basic test with 2 components in 1 group - `tests/pcb/pcb-component-multiple-groups.test.ts` - Complex test with 4 groups and varied component sizes - Deleted old silkscreen text tests (feature not supported for text elements) ## Example Output The visualization shows: - Group outlines (blue dashed boxes) when `showPcbGroups: true` - Crosshair markers at group anchor points - Dimension lines with measurements in mm - Clear visual relationship between group anchors and component positions

title: feat: Add covered_with_solder_mask support to copper pours
description: Adds a boolean property, covered_with_solder_mask, to copper pour elements, allowing for solder mask-free regions when set to false.
body:
This pull request introduces a new boolean property, covered_with_solder_mask, to copper pour elements.           

When covered_with_solder_mask is set to false, the copper pour's shape is added to the corresponding solder mask  
layer. This creates a solder mask-free region, exposing the copper pour.                                          

The default behavior remains unchanged: copper pours are covered with solder mask if the property is true or not  
specified.                                                                                                        

An existing test has been updated to verify this new functionality.

title: Handle session expiration by clearing session when receiving a 401 error
description: Fixes session handling by automatically clearing expired sessions and preventing duplicate unauthorized notifications when a 401 error occurs.
body:
## Issue Description

Fixes #1933

When a user's session expires or is invalidated on the backend but remains in localStorage, the UI incorrectly shows them as logged in while all API calls fail with 401 errors. This creates:
- Multiple "Unauthorized" toast notifications spamming the screen (one per failed API call)
- UI showing logged-in state while user can't perform authenticated actions
- No automatic recovery - stale session persists until manually cleared

## Changes Applied

### `src/hooks/use-axios.tsx`
- **Toast deduplication**: Added `has401ToastBeenShown` flag to prevent duplicate toasts when multiple API calls fail simultaneously. Flag resets after 6 seconds.
- **Automatic session cleanup**: On 401 detection, immediately call `setSession(null)` to clear stale session from localStorage, updating UI to logged-out state.
- **Conditional toast**: Only show "Unauthorized" toast when a session exists (prevents errors on public pages).

## Before Video


https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d2d87095-4a0b-4c2e-9c44-f965b537e9dd





## After Video


https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e132993b-b26c-4285-8cd3-30d95fa9ac41


Discord Thread:
https://discord.com/channels/1233487248129921135/1435373358442090717

body:
This makes the partsEngineDisabled property functional. When partsEngineDisabled is set to true in the     
configuration (platform or projectConfig), the partsEngine is explicitly set to undefined.                        

A new test file with two test cases has been added to verify that the parts engine is disabled when the flag is   
set via either projectConfig or the main platform config.

title: First tscircuit scripting guide, how to programmatically get the circuit size
description: Rewrite the measuring circuit size guide to focus on board template selection and remove Adom-specific wording, document JSON metadata imports and add a metadata-driven carrier example, embed a CircuitPreview that loads metadata via fsMap to demonstrate template selection.
body:
## Summary
- rewrite the measuring circuit size guide to focus on board template selection and remove Adom-specific wording
- document JSON metadata imports and add a metadata-driven carrier example
- embed a CircuitPreview that loads metadata via fsMap to demonstrate template selection

## Testing
- bunx tsc --noEmit *(fails: repository lacks local Docusaurus/React dependencies and JSX settings in this environment)*
- bun run format *(fails: `biome` CLI is not installed in the container)*

------

title: Add off-board obstacle connectivity metadata
description: Adds an optional offBoardConnectsTo array to SRJ obstacles to describe off-board connectivity and merges these connections into the connectivity map, allowing assignable obstacles to share nets.
body:
## Summary
- add an optional `offBoardConnectsTo` array to SRJ obstacles to describe off-board connectivity
- merge off-board connections into the connectivity map so assignable obstacles share nets
- document the new field and cover it with a unit test

## Testing
- bunx tsc --noEmit *(fails: existing type errors in tests/core[1-3].test.tsx)*
- bun test tests/utils/getConnectivityMapFromSimpleRouteJson.test.ts
- bun run format


------
[Codex Task](https://chatgpt.com/codex/tasks/task_b_690fb96a72fc832eb924dc603dba3674)

title: Ensure correct orientation for polygon board outlines
description: Fixes incorrect handling of board shapes defined by custom polygons in the copper pour solver due to inconsistent winding order, ensuring proper boolean operations for copper pour geometry.
body:
This pull request addresses an issue where the copper pour solver failed to     
correctly handle board shapes defined by custom polygons.                       

Problem                                                                         

The boolean subtraction operations performed by flatten-js require polygons to  
have a consistent winding order (orientation). When a board outline was created 
from a custom polygon, it could have a Clockwise (CW) orientation. This         
inconsistency caused subsequent subtraction operations to behave like unions,   
resulting in incorrect copper pour geometry.                                    

Solution                                                                        

The getBoardPolygon function has been updated to check the orientation of the   
polygon created from a custom board outline. If the polygon is found to have a  
CW orientation, it is reversed to ensure a consistent Counter-Clockwise (CCW)   
winding order before being used in the solver.                                  

This change ensures that all boolean operations are performed on correctly      
oriented polygons, leading to the expected copper pour output.                  

A new test case (polygon-board-2) has been added to verify this fix and prevent 
future regressions.

title: feat: Implement copper pour clearance for PCB cutouts
description: Adds support for pcb_cutout elements to the copper pour solver, allowing for proper clearance around board cutouts.
body:
This pull request adds support for pcb_cutout elements to the copper pour       
solver, allowing for proper clearance around board cutouts.                     

Key Changes:                                                                    

 â€¢ Cutout Margin: Introduces a new cutout_margin option to specify the clearance
   distance around pcb_cutout elements.                                         
 â€¢ Shape Support: Adds logic to process rectangular, circular, and polygonal    
   pcb_cutout shapes, treating them as obstacles for the copper pour.           
 â€¢ Polygon Handling: Implements a mitered offset for polygonal cutouts to ensure
   that the clearance preserves sharp corners, matching the cutout's geometry.  
 â€¢ Testing: A new test suite (hole-and-cutouts) is added to validate the new    
   functionality and ensure cutouts of all supported shapes are handled         
   correctly.

title: feat(vias): Add cutouts for vias and associated traces
description: Add support for generating copper pour cutouts around vias and their connected traces, processing pcb_via elements as circular obstacles and updating pcb_trace parsing logic for multi-layer traces.
body:
This change introduces support for generating copper pour cutouts around  
vias and their connected traces.                                                

 â€¢ pcb_via elements are now processed as circular obstacles, respecting the     
   pad_margin.                                                                  
 â€¢ The pcb_trace parsing logic is updated to handle multi-layer traces, ensuring
   that segments on the specified layer are correctly identified as obstacles.

title: refactor(tests): Use descriptive names for test files
description: This change renames several test files and their corresponding assets to have more descriptive names that reflect their purpose.
body:
This change renames several test files and their corresponding assets to have   
more descriptive names that reflect their purpose. The original generic names   
like circuit-1.test.ts made it difficult to understand what each test was       
covering.                                                                       

The following files have been renamed:                                          

 â€¢ circuit-1 -> pad-margin                                                      
 â€¢ circuit-2 -> larger-trace-margin                                             
 â€¢ circuit-3 -> smaller-trace-margin                                            
 â€¢ circuit-6 -> polygon-board                                                   
 â€¢ circuit-7 -> board-edge-margin                                               
 â€¢ circuit-8 -> board-edge-margin-2                                             

This refactoring improves the maintainability and clarity of the test suite.

with the snake_case naming convention used for other properties in the project.

title: feat: Add boardEdgeMargin support for copper pours
description: Adds support for a boardEdgeMargin parameter to control clearance between copper pours and board edges, improving handling of complex board shapes.
body:
This pull request introduces support for adding a clearance between the copper pour and the     
board edge, controlled by a new boardEdgeMargin parameter.                                      

When a boardEdgeMargin is provided:                                                             

 â€¢ For rectangular boards, the pour area is inset by the margin amount.                         
 â€¢ For boards with custom polygon outlines, a series of obstacles are generated along the       
   outline to create the margin. This approach ensures that concave (inner) corners of the pour 
   remain sharp, while convex (outer) corners are rounded.                                      

This PR also includes:                                                                          

 â€¢ An improvement to the boolean subtraction logic to correctly handle cases where a pour is    
   split into multiple polygons.                                                                
 â€¢ New test cases (circuit-7 and circuit-8) to validate the boardEdgeMargin feature on complex  
   board shapes.

title: feat: Implement copper pour solver pipeline
description: This pull request implements the core logic for the copper pour solver. It introduces a complete pipeline that takes a circuit-json input and generates B-Rep shapes for the copper pour regions. Key changes include: Copper Pour Solver Implementation: The CopperPourPipelineSolver is built out to process obstacles, perform boolean geometry operations using flatten-js, and generate final B-Rep shapes. Circuit JSON Conversion: A new function convertCircuitJsonToInputProblem is added to translate standard circuit-json elements (pads, traces, holes) into the solvers internal InputProblem format. Comprehensive Testing: A suite of snapshot tests has been added, rendering the output of the solver to SVG for multiple circuit configurations to visually validate the results. Type Definitions: Updated libtypes.ts to support various pad shapes (rect, circle, trace) and define the solvers input and output structures. Dependency Updates: Added flatten-jscore for geometric calculations and circuit-to-svg for test rendering.
body:
This pull request implements the core logic for the copper pour solver. It introduces a complete
pipeline that takes a circuit-json input and generates B-Rep shapes for the copper pour regions.

Key changes include:                                                                            

 â€¢ Copper Pour Solver Implementation: The CopperPourPipelineSolver is built out to process      
   obstacles, perform boolean geometry operations using flatten-js, and generate final B-Rep    
   shapes.                                                                                      
 â€¢ Circuit JSON Conversion: A new function convertCircuitJsonToInputProblem is added to         
   translate standard circuit-json elements (pads, traces, holes) into the solver's internal    
   InputProblem format.                                                                         
 â€¢ Comprehensive Testing: A suite of snapshot tests has been added, rendering the output of the 
   solver to SVG for multiple circuit configurations to visually validate the results.          
 â€¢ Type Definitions: Updated lib/types.ts to support various pad shapes (rect, circle, trace)   
   and define the solver's input and output structures.                                         
 â€¢ Dependency Updates: Added @flatten-js/core for geometric calculations and circuit-to-svg for 
   test rendering.

title: support the fill token with string value
description: Adds support for the fill token in PadPrimitiveGrPoly, allowing it to accept a string value for fill properties.

title: add the graphicsPoly and graphicsRect in kicadpcb type
description: Adds graphic polygon and rectangle support to the KicadPcb type in the KiCad TypeScript library.

title: feat: add `GrCircle`, `Group` and `GrRect`
description: Add new classes for graphical elements: GrCircle, GrRect, and Group, including properties for locked state and UUID.

title: feat: add GrPoly and fix the GrText to add render_cache
description: Adds GrPoly class for polygon representation and enhances GrText class by introducing render_cache functionality for improved text rendering.

title: fix: add the polygon smtpads support
description: The ViaGridBoard in the common module should be supported for export
body: The ViaGridBoard in the common module should be supported for export

title: support `gr_poly` to `pcb_smtpad` to the shape of `polygon`
description: Adds support for gr_poly shapes in pcb_smtpad, allowing for polygon-shaped SMT pads in PCB designs.

title: fix: add the missing shape for the smtpad shaped `rect`
description: This pull request adds the missing shape for the smtpad shaped rect in the PCB design process. It ensures that the correct shape is assigned to the smtpad based on the provided parameters, enhancing the accuracy of the PCB representation in the circuit JSON output.

title: add ViaGridBoard
description: This pull request introduces the ViaGridBoard feature, which processes filled rectangles on copper layers and creates corresponding SMT pads in the PCB design. It enhances the PCB graphics processing capabilities by adding support for gr_rect elements, allowing for better representation of PCB designs in the Circuit JSON format. Additionally, it updates the kicadts dependency to a newer version and includes new test snapshots and assets for the ViaGridBoard functionality.

title: Parse the `gr_poly` and convert to pcb_smtpad shape polygon
description: Adds functionality to parse gr_poly elements and convert them into pcb_smtpad shape polygons for filled polygons on copper layers.
